meanings.definition: To comb or brush (flax or hemp) with a hatchel.
meanings.sent1: She hatcheled the flax carefully to remove any tangles.
meanings.sent2: The farmer hatcheled the hemp before spinning it into yarn.
meanings.sent3: The flax felt grateful to be hatcheled and smoothed out.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a mess until she hatcheled through her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the hatchel against the flax was oddly soothing.

meanings.definition: To separate the coarse parts of (flax or hemp) with a hatchel.
meanings.sent1: He hatcheled the hemp fibers to remove any rough bits.
meanings.sent2: The worker hatcheled the flax to get rid of impurities.
meanings.sent3: The flax fibers cheered as they were hatcheled apart.
meanings.sent4: She hatcheled through the problems, leaving only solutions behind.
meanings.sent5: The hatchel worked its magic, leaving behind only smooth fibers.

meanings.definition: To dress (flax or hemp) with a hatchel.
meanings.sent1: They hatcheled the flax to prepare it for weaving.
meanings.sent2: The artisan hatcheled the hemp to make it ready for use.
meanings.sent3: The flax was excited to be hatcheled into its finest form.
meanings.sent4: She hatcheled her outfit with care, ensuring it looked perfect.
meanings.sent5: The hatchel transformed the flax into a work of art.
